title: Data Limite segundo Chico Xavier (2014)
overview: UFO experts claim that after the explosion of the bombs on Hiroshima and Nagasaki, there was an increase in the number of sightings of UFO'S (Unidentified Flying Objects) worldwide. Just over two decades later, the Brazilian medium Chico Xavier confided to close friends that when man reached the moon on July 20, 1969, happened a meeting with the celestial beings of our solar system to check the progress of humanity. They decided to grant a period of 50 years for humanity to evolve morally and live in peace, without provoking a third world war. If we live in peace until the Deadline, humanity would be ready to enter a new era of its existence, and magnificent feats would be checked everywhere, including our brothers from other planets would be expressly authorized to present themselves publicly and officially to Earth's residents.
storyline: UFO experts claim that after the explosion of the bombs on Hiroshima and Nagasaki, there was an increase in the number of sightings of UFO'S (Unidentified Flying Objects) worldwide. Just over two decades later, the Brazilian medium Chico Xavier confided to close friends that when man reached the moon on July 20, 1969, happened a meeting with the celestial beings of our solar system to check the progress of humanity. They decided to grant a period of 50 years for humanity to evolve morally and live in peace, without provoking a third world war. If we live in peace until the Deadline, humanity would be ready to enter a new era of its existence, and magnificent feats would be checked everywhere, including our brothers from other planets would be expressly authorized to present themselves publicly and officially to Earth's residents.
synopsis:
The Brazilian documentary "Data Limite" (Deadline) brings to the public, the revelation of Chico Xavier about a deadline for mankind to learn the life in peace without destroying the Earth.
Through, confirmed predictions, interviews with friends and experts in ufology and international relations, the film shows possible future for our species if we learn to live in peace.
Respondents claim that after the explosion of atomic tests there was a considerable increase in the number of UFO sightings'S (Unidentified Flying Objects) worldwide.
Chico Xavier in a television program in 1971, states that if humanity did not start a major war in the 50 years after the arrival to the moon, we'll find interplanetary beings.
Data Limite makes no apology to any religion, but brings to the audience a reflection on the individual moral values.
It's a documentary to reflect and report on the not too distant future.
